task_summary: Align above the grid fixture and place the grid clamp, then release and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base robot arm with a parallel gripper must place a small grid clamp onto a grid/fixture near a SARA-branded block on a tabletop. The contact sheet shows the end-effector already holding the clamp, approaching the fixture, aligning, making gentle contact, releasing, and retreating. The process emphasizes precise lateral alignment and controlled vertical approach to avoid knocking nearby items. Orientation about yaw is adjusted before final descent to match the fixture slots.
preconditions: Clamp already grasped in the gripper
Fixture pose observable by the camera/sensor
Robot homed and within reach of the fixture
stepwise_plan: Verify the clamp is in the gripper and move to a safe height above the grid fixture.
Perceive the fixture and refine alignment laterally and in yaw.
Lower slowly until contact is detected and place the clamp onto the fixture.
Open the gripper to release the clamp and retreat to a safe distance.
success_criteria: Clamp rests stably on the target fixture surface
No displacement of nearby items during placement
End-effector retreats without re-contact after release
failure_and_recovery: If fixture not detected, retry perception up to three attempts and re-approach.
If alignment drifts, repeat the alignment step and adjust yaw.
If contact occurs prematurely, retreat slightly and re-lower slowly.
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after successful release and retreat, or upon unrecoverable failure (e.g., repeated perception failure).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Ensure the clamp is currently held before placing.
Move to a safe pre-place height above the grid fixture.
Perceive the fixture to refine target pose; wrapped in retry.
Lateral approach and precise alignment to the fixture.
Orient the tool yaw to match fixture orientation.
Controlled vertical descent until gentle contact.
Place the clamp onto the fixture surface.
Back off to a safe distance after placement.
Retry perception a limited number of times to increase robustness.
Single root composite enforcing strict order of operations.

failure_modes: Fixture not detected or partially occluded
Premature contact causing clamp to tip
Release failure due to clamp sticking in gripper
recovery_strategy: Retry perception and slightly adjust view by re-approaching
Re-run alignment and yaw set before descent
Retreat a small distance and lower again slowly
Open/close gripper once and tap down with minimal force before retry
assumptions: The clamp starts already grasped, as suggested by frames showing the gripper near the fixture.
The target surface is a grid/fixture near the SARA block; instruction mentions only 'grid clamp' so fixture identity is inferred from visuals.
No human or external disturbances during the sequence.

expected_success_criteria: Clamp rests stably on the grid fixture with no wobble
Robot retreats without re-contact after opening gripper
